title: 八十後上班族，月入十萬，你問我答

replies.msg:
呢排日日work from home實在太無聊
出個post黎玩下
你唔信我無所謂，網上大把人吹水，信咪R下水吹囉
我自己答左d基本題先：

Q1：月入十萬即係幾錢？
我底薪係十萬多千零蚊一個月，冇佣金，年尾花紅可以係零到最多三十幾萬，另外每年都派公司股權值零到最多二十幾萬。一般就係拎個range既中位數但好視乎表現。

Q2：做咩行業/公司/職位？
香港靠底薪月入過十萬既八十後打工仔肯定少過3%，而且一定有人眼紅。我唔知其他同事會唔會睇到，但我唔會披露太多同身份相關既資料。只可以話係金融財務相關，非銷售類既職位。公司係美國top 500上市公司，全球幾萬員工。我職位係負責管理亞太區某部門既其中一項主要業務。

Q3：工作經歷係點？
詳細寫就出本書都得。只講略要的話，我第一份工十七年前入職5500蚊一個月，總共做過三份工。之後大部份時間都係appraisal最高分同加薪雙位數%，拎過精英員工獎同參加過全球精英員工訓練營。除香港以外，曾經去過另外兩個國家做expat。

Q4: 學歷如何？
呢題其實我唔係好想答，因為符合我咁既背景，年齡同職位既人係香港應該唔超過十個人。不過唔答你地又一定會好奇，我就索性答埋，我因為某d原因冇讀到大學，只有文憑。不過我英文好過大多數香港人，大約呢種水平：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ES73LXd4LGg

好，係咁多先，得閒同想答先會答。

以前我做散仔時，以為出現問題時，推薦到個解決方法俾上司就夠。
後來先發現，出現問題，你就要分析埋root cause，rationale、impact of solution同負責人，要好似落軍令狀咁講話幾時解決，解決後對生意影響幾大等。

我自己答左d基本題先：

Q1：月入十萬即係幾錢？
我底薪係十萬多千零蚊一個月，冇佣金，年尾花紅可以係零到最多三十幾萬，另外每年都派公司股權值零到最多二十幾萬。一般就係拎個range既中位數但好視乎表現。

Q2：做咩行業/公司/職位？
香港靠底薪月入過十萬既八十後打工仔肯定少過3%，而且一定有人眼紅。我唔知其他同事會唔會睇到，但我唔會披露太多同身份相關既資料。只可以話係金融財務相關，非銷售類既職位。公司係美國top 500上市公司，全球幾萬員工。我職位係負責管理亞太區某部門既其中一項主要業務。

Q3：工作經歷係點？
詳細寫就出本書都得。只講略要的話，我第一份工十七年前入職5500蚊一個月，總共做過三份工。之後大部份時間都係appraisal最高分同加薪雙位數%，拎過精英員工獎同參加過全球精英員工訓練營。除香港以外，曾經去過另外兩個國家做expat。

Q4: 學歷如何？
呢題其實我唔係好想答，因為符合我咁既背景，年齡同職位既人係香港應該唔超過十個人。不過唔答你地又一定會好奇，我就索性答埋，我因為某d原因冇讀到大學，只有文憑。不過我英文好過大多數香港人，大約呢種水平：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ES73LXd4LGg

好，係咁多先，得閒同想答先會答。

我自己答左d基本題先：

Q1：月入十萬即係幾錢？
我底薪係十萬多千零蚊一個月，冇佣金，年尾花紅可以係零到最多三十幾萬，另外每年都派公司股權值零到最多二十幾萬。一般就係拎個range既中位數但好視乎表現。

Q2：做咩行業/公司/職位？
香港靠底薪月入過十萬既八十後打工仔肯定少過3%，而且一定有人眼紅。我唔知其他同事會唔會睇到，但我唔會披露太多同身份相關既資料。只可以話係金融財務相關，非銷售類既職位。公司係美國top 500上市公司，全球幾萬員工。我職位係負責管理亞太區某部門既其中一項主要業務。

Q3：工作經歷係點？
詳細寫就出本書都得。只講略要的話，我第一份工十七年前入職5500蚊一個月，總共做過三份工。之後大部份時間都係appraisal最高分同加薪雙位數%，拎過精英員工獎同參加過全球精英員工訓練營。除香港以外，曾經去過另外兩個國家做expat。

Q4: 學歷如何？
呢題其實我唔係好想答，因為符合我咁既背景，年齡同職位既人係香港應該唔超過十個人。不過唔答你地又一定會好奇，我就索性答埋，我因為某d原因冇讀到大學，只有文憑。不過我英文好過大多數香港人，大約呢種水平：

If he had pursued a career in sales rather than accounting, his salary would be much lower. If it hadn't been for his auntie's referral, his career wouldn't take off now and he wouldn't start earning a lot of money. He's been having a crush on this girl named Jo but Jo has a boyfriend. His friend said "That's totally fair. She's quite attractive." But he's beginning to realise he has no place in her scheme of things. He's just being a doormat so I told him to forget her. She's just not worth it. His uncle said "You would be better off without her." His mother too said "You'll be better off without her." He's a science fiction fan. 我自己答左d基本題先：

Q1：月入十萬即係幾錢？
我底薪係十萬多千零蚊一個月，冇佣金，年尾花紅可以係零到最多三十幾萬，另外每年都派公司股權值零到最多二十幾萬。一般就係拎個range既中位數但好視乎表現。

Q2：做咩行業/公司/職位？
香港靠底薪月入過十萬既八十後打工仔肯定少過3%，而且一定有人眼紅。我唔知其他同事會唔會睇到，但我唔會披露太多同身份相關既資料。只可以話係金融財務相關，非銷售類既職位。公司係美國top 500上市公司，全球幾萬員工。我職位係負責管理亞太區某部門既其中一項主要業務。

Q3：工作經歷係點？
詳細寫就出本書都得。只講略要的話，我第一份工十七年前入職5500蚊一個月，總共做過三份工。之後大部份時間都係appraisal最高分同加薪雙位數%，拎過精英員工獎同參加過全球精英員工訓練營。除香港以外，曾經去過另外兩個國家做expat。

Q4: 學歷如何？
呢題其實我唔係好想答，因為符合我咁既背景，年齡同職位既人係香港應該唔超過十個人。不過唔答你地又一定會好奇，我就索性答埋，我因為某d原因冇讀到大學，只有文憑。不過我英文好過大多數香港人，大約呢種水平：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ES73LXd4LGg

好，係咁多先，得閒同想答先會答。

我自己答左d基本題先：

Q1：月入十萬即係幾錢？
我底薪係十萬多千零蚊一個月，冇佣金，年尾花紅可以係零到最多三十幾萬，另外每年都派公司股權值零到最多二十幾萬。一般就係拎個range既中位數但好視乎表現。

Q2：做咩行業/公司/職位？
香港靠底薪月入過十萬既八十後打工仔肯定少過3%，而且一定有人眼紅。我唔知其他同事會唔會睇到，但我唔會披露太多同身份相關既資料。只可以話係金融財務相關，非銷售類既職位。公司係美國top 500上市公司，全球幾萬員工。我職位係負責管理亞太區某部門既其中一項主要業務。

Q3：工作經歷係點？
詳細寫就出本書都得。只講略要的話，我第一份工十七年前入職5500蚊一個月，總共做過三份工。之後大部份時間都係appraisal最高分同加薪雙位數%，拎過精英員工獎同參加過全球精英員工訓練營。除香港以外，曾經去過另外兩個國家做expat。

Q4: 學歷如何？
呢題其實我唔係好想答，因為符合我咁既背景，年齡同職位既人係香港應該唔超過十個人。不過唔答你地又一定會好奇，我就索性答埋，我因為某d原因冇讀到大學，只有文憑。不過我英文好過大多數香港人，大約呢種水平：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ES73LXd4LGg

好，係咁多先，得閒同想答先會答。

我急不及待好想玩玩了

My friend Paul works as an accountant at Hilton but if he takes the job at Big 4, he'll be four thousand eight hundred dollars a month better off but he's still better off now than he was two years ago when he was working below everybody else in the department. He thinks a junior accountant position is beneath him. If he hadn't taken the CPA exams two years before, he wouldn't be working as a manager now. If he had pursued a career in sales rather than accounting, his salary would be much lower. If it hadn't been for his auntie's referral, his career wouldn't take off now and he wouldn't start earning a lot of money. He's been having a crush on this girl named Jo for eight years but Jo has a boyfriend. His friend said "That's totally fair. She's quite attractive." But he's beginning to realise he has no place in her scheme of things. He's just being a doormat so I told him to forget her. She's just not worth it. His uncle said "You would be better off without her." His mother too said "You'll be better off without her." He's a science fiction fan. He said "If starships really would exist, I would quit my job and spend the rest of my life roaming the universe." Recently, his sister married her childhood sweetheart. His father felt she was marrying beneath her though. Her uncle told feels her husband is beneath her. She enjoys socializing with the better off. Last month, Paul was away on a business trip to Hokkaido. After his trip, I said "If you should travel there again, can you get me a pack of White Lover Cookies please?" Paul is a computer expert. His cousin has to write a report which is due on Thursday but he's having problems with his computer. If Paul will go and fix his computer, he'll be so thankful for his help. He also has exams next Monday so he's better off revising at home over the weekend. Paul is a kickboxing fan. His favourite fighter Dan has won his retirement fight lately. He's eternally grateful to his coaches and thankful that he's got a job as a colour commentator after he retired from the sport. All the fans wanna see Fred versus Randy. If Fred would sign a contract with the organisation, Dana will make the fight happen. When Randy was reading the terms and conditions of the contract, Dana's assistant said "If you would just sign here please." Paul's brother is a concierge in a hotel. I said "If it'll make you happy, I'll come to stay for a night as company for you while your colleagues are away." Last week, Paul gave a party at his place. His television is cheap and nasty. As many of us wanted to watch the news, I said "If I could turn the television on please." He then said "Sure. If you would switch to the news channel." I saw Joey live twice with my friends which was marvelous and unforgettable. The first time we saw her concert, we were late. I remember I said "Look at the time. The concert will have begun." 我唸起「急不及待想玩玩了」條友

My friend Paul is an accounting manager at Hilton but if he takes the job at Big 4, he'll be four thousand eight hundred dollars a month better off but he's still better off now than he was two years ago when he was working below everybody else in the department. He thinks a junior accountant position is beneath him. If he hadn't taken the CPA exam two years before, he wouldn't be working as a manager now. If he had pursued a career in sales rather than accounting, his salary would be much lower. If it hadn't been for his auntie's referral, his career wouldn't take off now and he wouldn't start earning a lot of money. He's been having a crush on this girl named Jo for eight years but Jo has a boyfriend. His friend said "That's totally fair. She's quite attractive." But he's beginning to realise he has no place in her scheme of things. He's just being a doormat so I told him to forget her. She's just not worth it. His uncle said "You would be better off without her." His mother too said "You'll be better off without her." He's a science fiction fan. He said "If starships really would exist, I would quit my job and spend the rest of my life roaming the universe." Recently, his sister married her childhood sweetheart. Her father felt she was marrying beneath her though. Her uncle too feels her husband is beneath her. She enjoys socializing with the better off. Last month, Paul was away on a business trip to Hokkaido. After his trip, I said "If you should travel there again, can you get me a pack of White Lover Cookies please?" Paul is a computer expert. His cousin has to write a report which is due on Thursday but he's having problems with his computer. If Paul will go and fix his computer, he'll be so thankful for his help. He also has exams next Monday so he's better off revising at home over the weekend. Paul is a kickboxing fan. His favourite fighter Dan has won his retirement fight lately. Dan is eternally grateful to his coaches and thankful that he's got a job as a colour commentator after he retired from the sport. All the fans wanna see Fred versus Randy. If Fred would sign a contract with the organization, Dana will make the fight happen. When Randy was reading the terms and conditions of the contract, Dana's assistant said "If you would just sign here please." Paul's brother is a concierge in a hotel. I said "If it'll make you happy, I'll come to stay for a night as company for you while your colleagues are away." My friend John isn't very well-to-do while his girlfriend's family is very well-off. Last week, he gave a party at his place where cheap wines were served. The sofas in his flat are made of some cheap material. His television is cheap and nasty. As many of us wanted to watch the news, I said "If I could turn the television on please." He then said "Sure. If you would switch to the news channel." I saw Joey live twice at the Hong Kong Coliseum with my friends which was marvelous and unforgettable. The first time we saw her concert, we were late. I remember I said "Look at the time. The concert will have begun." It was quarter after eight. The concert would've started by then. By the end of the next century, scientists will have invented starships. As I'm fascinated by the science of starships, I'm going to ask physics professor Dr. Chow about it. I'm gonna wait outside the lecture room at five of six. He will have finished his lecture. I thought about phoning him at twenty of two but my friend said "Don't phone him now. He won't have finished his lecture yet." It's true that he wouldn't have finished teaching yet.
